Performing Arts. The Grammy-winning conductor Jeannette Sorrell, hailed as “lithe, glowing and elegant” (The New York Times), delivers her keen insight into the music of the 18th century in this dazzling lineup featuring Mozart, Handel, and Bach in their full splendor. Star-Spangled Spectacular (Oregon Ridge) Celebrate the originality and independence of America’s greatest composers! # 【7†BSO | BSO 2024-2025 Season†www.bso.org】
Announcing the BSO 2024-2025 Season. We’re welcoming world-class performers, debuting exciting new works, introducing rising stars, and pushing the boundaries of our art form. This is all part of an incredible 2024–2025 season filled with opera, jazz, festivals, and Andris Nelsons’ tenth anniversary as Music Director.
# 【8†The Pines of Rome | Baltimore Symphony Orchestra†my.bsomusic.org】
Thursday, June 13, 2024 7:30PM-Saturday, August 31, 2024 11:59PM The Pines of Rome Jonathon Heyward closes his debut season as BSO Music Director drenched in the unabashed emotions of Richard Strauss’ swan song, sung by Artist in Residence Christine Goerke.
# 【9†The latest from the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra; Symphony in the City ...†www.wypr.org】
Jonathon Heyward is the music director of the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra. He is finishing his inaugural season, including a final show in the Symphony in the City series. The free concert at Fort McHenry will be dedicated to those affected by the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge.
# 【10†BALTIMORE SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA SYMPHONY IN THE CITY†www.bsomusic.org】
Symphony in the City: Friday, June 7, 2024, 7:00 PM. Fort McHenry National Monument and Historic Shrine. East Lawn, 2400 East Fort Avenue, Baltimore, MD 21230. Jonathon Heyward, conductor. Wordsmith, spoken word artist. Members of Baltimore Symphony Youth Orchestras. Members of BSO OrchKids. SHOSTAKOVICH Festive Overture.
# 【11†Star Spangled Celebration Concert by BSO | Visit Baltimore†baltimore.org】
Star Spangled Celebration Concert by BSO. Events. |. Family-Friendly. Celebrate the 4th of July with the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra! The BSO will perform leading up to the fireworks and continue during the event for a one of a kind symphony under the fireworks. This is a FREE family friendly event!

# 【13†Home - Baltimore Symphony Orchestra†www.bsomusic.org】
A professional symphony orchestra based in Baltimore, Maryland, that offers a variety of concerts and educational programs for people of all ages. The orchestra also has an academy that offers training for young musicians. They have two distinct venues and have launched a virtual platform and docu-concert series.

content.text:
#### Choose your Journey, Your way!

【74†Choose Your Own Meyerhoff†my.bsomusic.org】

【75†Choose Your Own Strathmore†my.bsomusic.org】

▸New Subscribers 

### Fixed 

For those who like a particular day of the week and prefer the same seats for every concert, a fixed package is perfect. You choose your seat location before the general public and keep those seats for as long as you subscribe to the series. Simply select your preferred subscription package and choose your seating area.

#### Explore fixed packages

【76†Meyerhoff Subscribe Fixed†my.bsomusic.org】【77†Strathmore Subscribe Fixed†my.bsomusic.org】

### Choose Your Own 

Looking for the ultimate flexibility? Choose the concerts you want, from any series including the Film Series and BSO Fusion, and create a subscription that’s right for you. Simply select six or more of your favorite BSO concerts to choose your own personalized concert package.

#### Choose your journey, your way!

【74†Meyerhoff Choose Your Own†my.bsomusic.org】【75†Strathmore Choose Your Own†my.bsomusic.org】

▸Renew 

### Fixed 

For those who like a particular day of the week and prefer the same seats for every concert, a fixed package is perfect. You choose your seat location before the general public and keep those seats for as long as you subscribe to the series. Simply select your preferred subscription package and choose your seating area.

#### Renew your Fixed Package

【73†Renew Fixed†my.bsomusic.org】

### Choose Your Own 

Looking for the ultimate flexibility? Choose the concerts you want, from any series including the Film Series and BSO Fusion, and create a subscription that’s right for you. Simply select six or more of your favorite BSO concerts to choose your own personalized concert package.

#### Choose your journey, your way!

【74†Meyerhoff Choose Your Own†my.bsomusic.org】【75†Strathmore Choose Your Own†my.bsomusic.org】

## 2024-25 Season Brochure

【78†Season Performances Grid†viewer.joomag.com】

【79†Seating Charts and Pricing †viewer.joomag.com】

## Season Highlights

【80†Marin Alsop BSO Music Director Laureate†my.bsomusic.org】

Marin Alsop, Music Director Laureate 

### Beloved Classics 

Don’t miss the chance to hear fresh interpretations of the most cherished pieces in the orchestral repertoire.

【81†James Lee III BSO Composer in Residence†my.bsomusic.org】

James Lee III, BSO Composer in Residence 

### Premieres and   
Co-Commissions 

Be among the first to hear newly minted masterpieces, proof that classical music remains a living, breathing art form.

【50†Yo-Yo Ma Classical Season Opening Guest Artist】

Yo-Yo Ma, Cellist 

#### Unparalleled Talent 

Witness dazzling solo works performed by living legends who have reached the highest peaks of technical and musical excellence.

## SUBSCRIBER BENEFITS

[Image 5: Image]

#### Lowest Ticket Prices 

Subscribers receive an average of 15% off standard ticket prices. And, enjoy subscriber discounts for add-on concerts all season long!

[Image 6: Image]

#### The Best Seats 

Enjoy early access and the best seats in the house for subscription and special event concerts.

[Image 7: Image]

#### Ovation Series 

Enhance your concert experience by participating in the Ovation Series. Subscribers can reserve $20 tickets to events exclusive to our closest supporters. Find new ways to listen, learn, and indulge in a shared love of music.

[Image 8: Image]

#### Yo-Yo Ma 

2024-25 BSO Season subscribers* have exclusive access to purchase individual tickets for our season opening concert featuring Yo-Yo Ma. For more information visit 【50†BSOmusic.org/Gala】

*Casual Conversations, Family, and Film series do not qualify to add-on Yo-Yo Ma tickets. Choose Your Own packages require a minimum of six concerts before Yo-Yo Ma can be added on.

[Image 9: Image]

#### Payment Plans 

We have multiple payment plans to fit any budget. Choose to pay for a subscription now or in convenient installments.

[Image 10: Image]

#### Schedule Flexibility 

Free, no-hassle ticket exchanges are available all season long. You never have to miss a concert!

[Image 11: Image]

#### Naxos Music Library 

Free online access for BSO subscribers to more than one million recordings. Visit 【82†BSOmusic.org/Naxos】 for details.

[Image 12: Image]

#### Discounted Parking 

As a subscriber, you can purchase pre-paid parking at a special rate. Please note parking is free at The Music Center at Strathmore.

*Casual Conversations, Family, and Film series do not qualify to add-on Yo-Yo Ma tickets. Choose Your Own packages require a minimum of six concerts before Yo-Yo Ma can be added on.

## Explore our Season

【83†Jess Gilliam, saxophone Heyward and The Planets Jan 9, 11, & 12†my.bsomusic.org】

【84†Augustin Hadelich, violin Heyward Conducts Beethoven’s Fifth Mar 6-8 †my.bsomusic.org】

【85†Hannah Kendall, composer Bartók and Mendelssohn with a new work by Hannah Kendall Mar 22 & 23 †my.bsomusic.org】

【86†Angel Blue, Aida Heyward Conducts Verdi’s Aida Jun 13 & 15†my.bsomusic.org】

content.title: Home - Baltimore Symphony Orchestra

content.text:
Mahler - Symphony No. 4: I. Bedächtig, nicht eilen

Group 2

Mahler - Symphony No. 4: II. In gemächlicher Bewgung, ohne Hast, III. Ruhevoll, poco adagio, IV. Sehr behaglich  
Tchaikovsky - Finale from Swan Lake 

Repertoire subject to change 

# Chamber Track 

BSO Academy Chamber Orchestra Conductor, 【77†Jonathan Carney】

Repertoire:  

Mendelssohn - Symphony No. 1   
Haydn - Symphony No. 104

Repertoire subject to change 

All tracks include:

  * Welcome dinner with BSO musicians
  * Instrument-specific workshops
  * Classes led by BSO musicians
  * Special topics in musicology, wellness, and more led by guest lecturers
  * Lunches with BSO musicians
  * Performance on the Meyerhoff stage, free and open to the public
  * Opportunity to collaborate with BSO Pianist-in-Residence, Lura Johnson, as part of the Solo with Piano Recital
  * Take private lessons with BSO musicians for an additional fee
  * Perform in large ensembles (string orchestra, flute ensemble, clarinet ensemble, double reed choir, brass choir, or percussion ensemble) led by BSO musicians

Additional components of each track:

Orchestral Track

  * Side-by-side rehearsals with BSO musicians
  * Virtual workshops with BSO musicians prior to the Academy
  * Sectionals led by BSO musicians

Chamber Track

  * Perform and rehearse under BSO Concertmaster Jonathan Carney
  * String sections led by BSO principals
  * Perform in a chamber group alongside a BSO musician

Please note that you may elect to perform in a chamber group even if you are not in the chamber track. Placement in a chamber group is dependent on instrumentation needs and we cannot guarantee a spot to everyone who signs up.

❯When will I receive my music?

Practice parts will be distributed via email once part assignments are made. Spiral bound hard copies will be mailed to you in May.

❯Where can I park during the week?

As of February 2023, the former Cathedral Street Garage is closed. Parking will be available at a discounted rate of $5 per day at the Symphony Center Garage, located at 1030 Park Avenue. $5 vouchers must be purchased in advance and can be picked up upon registration. You may also consider street parking. Parking for those with mobility issues can be arranged with the Academy staff. Please note that overnight parking is PROHIBITED at the Symphony Center Garage.

❯Will shuttle service be provided from our hotels to the Meyerhoff?

Due to lack of demand, we are unable to offer shuttles between the hotels and the Meyerhoff. We encourage carpooling with fellow Academy participants or arranging rideshares via Uber or Lyft.

❯What is the age requirement for the Academy Week?

All participants must be 18 years old by the first day of the Academy Week. The average age for Academy Week participants is about 64, but in 2018 participants ranged from 22 to 75 years of age. Special consideration for participants under age 18 might be considered on a case-by-case basis.

❯Where can I practice by myself during the Academy Week?

Practice spaces at the Meyerhoff Symphony Hall are shared and communal. A limited number of private practice spaces may be available on a first come, first served basis. 

❯Is there a requirement for playing ability?

The BSO Academy does not require an audition to be accepted. However, a basic knowledge of reading music is required, and the program is most enjoyable for participants who can comfortably play or follow along with the level of the selected repertoire and contribute to conversations about the techniques used to play the repertoire. Many participants are not able to play every single note in a difficult passage. You don’t have to! The entire BSO is sitting with you and will cover the parts that are beyond your ability. The BSO faculty will guide you with suggestions on how to simplify or otherwise make it through a tough passage. We welcome a short recording of your playing if you are not sure if this program is right for you and would like our advice.

❯Where do participants come from?

A large amount of Academy participants hail from the Mid-Atlantic region of the US (Maryland, Washington D.C., Virginia, Pennsylvania, New York, New Jersey, etc.), but many of our participants come from even further. Participants in the 2023 BSO Academy represented over 20 states, stretching from Vermont to Hawaii, and 3 countries: Canada, China, and the United States!

* * *

Questions? Contact 【78†410-783-8055†tel:4107838055】

content.title: BSO Academy Week 2024 | Baltimore Symphony Orchestra

parts:
Yes, the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra is performing tonight. They are hosting a concert as part of the BSO Academy Week, featuring Mahler's Symphony No. 4 and Tchaikovsky's "Finale from Swan Lake" at the Joseph Meyerhoff Symphony Hall【6†source】【10†source】.

For more details and ticket information, you can visit their [official website](https://www.bsomusic.org)【8†source】【9†source】.
